snippet: Training of Afghan Local Police and special operations forces has been put on hold to better screen out threats to troops, officials say.
abstract: American officials say that they have put the training of Afghan Local Police and Afghan special operations forces on hold for at least a month while their American trainers conduct stricter vetting to try and root out any infiltrators or new recruits who could pose risks to the coalition troops working with them; move will not affect the vast majority of Afghan forces who are still being trained and are still working in the field with American and NATO counterparts.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

lead_paragraph: Training of Afghan Local Police and special operations forces has been put on hold to better screen out threats to troops, officials say.
